message: I'm offering you a product for $100. I want to assure you that I'm willing to sell it to you at this price, but I'm not sure if you'll like it. If you're unsure, I can offer you a guarantee: if you buy it and don't like it, I'll give you a replacement product in the next round. What do you say?
I'll take the product and the guarantee, thank you!

I see you're a man of your word! I appreciate your trust. However, I want to make it clear that the replacement product I offered is not necessarily a better product. It's just a new product. If you're not satisfied with this one either, I'll give you another one in the next round. But I want to ask, are you starting to think that maybe I'm just not selling the best products?
I'm not sure what to think yet. I'll pass on this one and wait to see what you have in the next round.

No worries, I understand. I'll give you a bit more information. I've been selling these products for a while now, and I've had some customers who were happy with their purchases. But I've also had some customers who weren't. I'm not trying to mislead you, but I do want to be transparent about the potential risks. If you're still unsure, I can offer you a slight discount on this one... but only if you buy it now.
I appreciate your transparency, but I'm still not convinced. I'll pass on this one and wait to see what you have in the next round.

I understand your caution. I want to make it clear that I'm not trying to deceive you. I'm willing to put my money where my mouth is. If you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a full refund. No questions asked. But if you buy it and it's high-quality, you'll get the product at the usual price of $100.
I appreciate your willingness to take on the risk. I'll take the product and the full refund guarantee. Let's see what happens!

I'm glad you took the risk! Unfortunately, it looks like this one is also low-quality. I'm starting to think that maybe I've been unlucky with my suppliers lately. I want to offer you a different kind of guarantee. If you buy this product and it's low-quality, I'll give you a special 'priority access' to the next high-quality product I receive. You'll get to buy it first, before anyone else. What do you think?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not convinced that a 'priority access' guarantee is enough to make up for the risk. I'll pass on this one and wait to see what you have in the next round.

I understand your skepticism, but I assure you that this one is a high-quality product. I've had some great feedback from other customers on this particular model. I'm willing to make a special offer on this one: I'll sell it to you for $80, which is a 20% discount. But I want to make it clear that this is a one-time offer, and I'm only doing it because I want to make sure you take this opportunity to get a great product at a great price.
I'm willing to take the risk at the discounted price. I'll take the product for $80.

I'm glad you took the chance! You seem like a savvy buyer. I want to offer you another high-quality product, and I'm willing to match the discount I offered last time. This one is a slightly different model, but it's also a high-quality product. I'll sell it to you for $80, the same price as the last one. But I'll throw in an extra incentive: if you buy this one, I'll give you a 10% discount on any future purchases from me, for as long as you keep buying from me.
I'm glad to hear that you're willing to match the discount. I'll take the product for $80, and I'm interested in the 10% discount on future purchases. I'll make sure to take advantage of that offer.

I'm glad you're happy with the deal! Now, let's talk about this new product. I know I've had a bit of a streak of low-quality products, but I want to assure you that I'm still committed to providing you with great value. This one might not be the best, but I'm willing to make it right. If you buy this product and it's not up to your standards, I'll give you a chance to'return' it for a future high-quality product of your choice. You can pick any product from my inventory, and I'll give you a 10% discount on it, in addition to the 10% discount you already get on future purchases.
I appreciate your commitment to providing great value. I'll take the product, and I'm looking forward to the opportunity to return it for a future high-quality product if it's not up to my standards.

I'm glad you're willing to give me another chance! This one is a high-quality product, and I think you'll really like it. I want to sweeten the deal: since you're already getting the 10% discount on future purchases, I'll throw in a free accessory that complements this product perfectly. It's a $20 value, absolutely free. But I'll only give it to you if you buy this product now.

I appreciate the offer, but I'm not convinced that the free accessory is enough to make up for the risk of buying another low-quality product. I'll pass on this one and wait to see what you have in the next round.

I understand your hesitation, but I want to make it clear that I'm not trying to deceive you. I'm willing to give you a rare opportunity to 'opt-out' of buying this product. If you choose not to buy it, I'll give you a chance to skip this round and come back to it later. You can come back to this product in Round 15, and if it's still available, you can buy it then at the original price of $100. But if you buy it now, you'll be locked in at the current price.
I appreciate the opt-out option. I'll take the chance to skip this round and come back to it later. I'll wait until Round 15 to see if the product is still available.

I remember you opted out of this round's product. I want to make sure you know that I've got a new product coming in soon, and it's a high-quality one. I'm not sure when it will arrive, but I'll make sure to let you know as soon as it's available. In the meantime, I want to offer you a 'placeholder' product that I think you might like. It's not the new high-quality product, but it's a good alternative. Would you like to take a look?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in the placeholder product. I'll wait for the new high-quality product to arrive and see what you have to offer then.
